intro: Gomphia pendula, commonly known as the hanging gomphia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its delicate, pendulous inflorescence that resembles a cluster of small, fuzzy balls. Gomphia pendula thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in areas with full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitat.
